monogr.title: Les Assyro-chaldéens: chrétiens d’Irak, d’Iran et de Turquie

biblStruct.note: This book offers a survey of the life of the Syriac-speaking churches in the Middle East. First their history, up to the present day, and their doctrines (e.g., Christology, 40-8, apologetics and Islam, 48-54), followed by an anthology of important texts (e.g., debates with Islam, 74-80, a massacre, 90-93, oecumenical documents, 100-6). In the chapters on sacred art and spiritual life: churches and convents, 115-123, inscriptions, 125-127, liturgies, 129-139. The chapter on social life describes the communities in various countries and the diaspora since 1915, with statistics; daily life, festivals (149-178).The actual organisations are the topic of the last chapter (189-194). Notes, bibliography and lists of patriarchs, the cultic calendar, photos, etc., conclude the book.
